title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L)
description: Achieve strong results in your G.C.E. A/L examinations in any stream. While there's no mandatory stream, Arts or Commerce can be beneficial. A high Z-score is required for entry into state university law faculties.

title: Obtain an LL.B Degree
description: Complete a Bachelor of Laws (LL.B) degree. This can be done through a state university or by completing the degree from a recognized foreign university (often through local providers). This is the academic foundation of your legal education.
skills: Understanding of Core Law Subjects (Criminal, Constitutional, Contract)
institutes: Faculty of Law, University of Colombo
General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU)
Local providers for University of London LL.B (e.g., CFPS, Horizon)

title: Sri Lanka Law College Examinations
description: This is the vocational training stage to become a practicing lawyer. You must pass the three years of examinations conducted by the Sri Lanka Law College to qualify to take the oaths as an Attorney-at-Law.

title: Apprenticeship and Taking Oaths
description: Undergo a mandatory period of apprenticeship (currently 6 months) under a senior lawyer with at least 8 years of practice. After successful completion, you will be called to the bar and take oaths as an Attorney-at-Law of the Supreme Court of Sri Lanka.
institutes: Apprenticeship under a senior lawyer or in the Attorney General's Department

title: Practice and Specialization
description: Begin your career in the official bar (Attorney General's Department), unofficial bar (private practice in civil or criminal law), or the corporate sector as a legal officer. Over time, you can specialize in areas like corporate law, intellectual property, or human rights.
institutes: Leading Law Firms (e.g., F. J. & G. de Saram, Julius & Creasy, D. L. & F. De Saram)
